required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Symptomatic Treatment Of Patients With Neuropathic Pain With LYRICA
clinical_study.official_title: Assessing the Treatment of Patients With Neuropathic Pain Using LYRICA; A Non Interventional Post-marketing Study (NI-PMS)

brief_summary.textblock: A Non-Interventional, Post-Marketing Surveillance (NI-PMS) study whose objectives were to assess the impact of pregabalin on subjects' pain, quality of sleep, and their general wellbeing, as well as the tolerance and safety of pregabalin in subjects with neuropathic pain.

detailed_description.textblock: A non-interventional study of patients diagnosed with neuropathic pain administered pregabalin and followed up for 8 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinician Global Improvement of Change (CGIC) at Final Visit (Week 8 or Discontinuation)
Patient Global Improvement of Change (PGIC) at Final Visit (Week 8 or Discontinuation)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of neuropathic pain and inclusion according to the current Summary of Product Characteristics.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The patients were excluded according to the current Summary of Product Characteristics.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 23 sites in Greece by investigators contracted by and under the direction of the sponsor. This study was performed by office-based physicians and in hospitals.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This study enrolled subjects with a confirmed diagnosis of neuropathic pain, according to the neuropathic pain diagnostic (DN4) Questionnaire, completed by the investigator at baseline

group.title: Pregabalin (150 mg to 600 mg Per Day in 2 to 3 Divided Doses)
group.description: 275 subjects received pregabalin alone while 416 subjects received pregabalin in combination with another neuropathic pain medication.

group.title: Pregabalin (150 mg to 600 mg Per Day in 2 to 3 Divided Doses)
group.description: 275 subjects received pregabalin alone while 416 subjects received pregabalin in combination with another neuropathic pain medication.

outcome.title: Anxiety and Depression Symptoms
outcome.description: The presence of anxiety and depression symptoms were measured, based on how often the subject felt a certain emotion over the past week. Q1:Have you felt calm and relaxed? Q2: Have you felt full of energy? Q3: Have you felt discouraged and sad? Final Visit = Week 8 or time of discontinuation.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS). Full analysis set was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward method (LOCF) was used.

group.title: Pregabalin (150 mg to 600 mg Per Day in 2 to 3 Divided Doses)
group.description: 275 subjects received pregabalin alone while 416 subjects received pregabalin in combination with another neuropathic pain medication.

measure.title: Anxiety and Depression Symptoms
measure.description: The presence of anxiety and depression symptoms were measured, based on how often the subject felt a certain emotion over the past week. Q1:Have you felt calm and relaxed? Q2: Have you felt full of energy? Q3: Have you felt discouraged and sad? Final Visit = Week 8 or time of discontinuation.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS). Full analysis set was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward method (LOCF) was used.

class.title: Q1 at baseline: Most of the time
Q1 at final visit: Most of the time
Q1 at final visit: Fairly often
Q1 at final visit: Not done
Q2 at baseline: Most of the time
Q2 at final visit: Most of the time
Q2 at final visit: Fairly often
Q2 at final visit: Not done
Q3 at baseline: Most of the time
Q3 final visit: Most of the time
Q3 at final visit: Fairly often
Q3 at final visit: Not done

outcome.title: Daily Average Pain Scores
outcome.description: Change is observed value at final visit (Week 8 or discontinuation) minus baseline value. Daily average pain score is measured using a 10-point Likert scale where 0 = no pain to 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS). Full analysis set was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used.

group.title: Pregabalin (150 mg to 600 mg Per Day in 2 to 3 Divided Doses)
group.description: 275 subjects received pregabalin alone while 416 subjects received pregabalin in combination with another neuropathic pain medication.

measure.title: Daily Average Pain Scores
measure.description: Change is observed value at final visit (Week 8 or discontinuation) minus baseline value. Daily average pain score is measured using a 10-point Likert scale where 0 = no pain to 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS). Full analysis set was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used.

outcome.title: Pain Related Sleep Interference
outcome.description: Change is observed value at final visit (Week 8 or discontinuation) minus baseline value. Pain related sleep interference is measured by a 10-point Likert scale where 0 = does not interfere with sleep, and 10 = completely interferes with sleep
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used.

group.title: Pregabalin (150 mg to 600 mg Per Day in 2 to 3 Divided Doses)
group.description: 275 subjects received pregabalin alone while 416 subjects received pregabalin in combination with another neuropathic pain medication.

measure.title: Pain Related Sleep Interference
measure.description: Change is observed value at final visit (Week 8 or discontinuation) minus baseline value. Pain related sleep interference is measured by a 10-point Likert scale where 0 = does not interfere with sleep, and 10 = completely interferes with sleep
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used.

outcome.title: Clinician Global Improvement of Change (CGIC) at Final Visit (Week 8 or Discontinuation)
outcome.description: Clinician Global Improvement of Change (CGIC) indicates the change of the severity of the condition from baseline, graded from "very much improved" to "very much worse".
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS). Full analysis set was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used. Three subjects were not included in the analysis due to incomplete case report forms.

group.title: Pregabalin (150 mg to 600 mg Per Day in 2 to 3 Divided Doses)
group.description: 275 subjects received pregabalin alone while 416 subjects received pregabalin in combination with another neuropathic pain medication.

measure.title: Clinician Global Improvement of Change (CGIC) at Final Visit (Week 8 or Discontinuation)
measure.description: Clinician Global Improvement of Change (CGIC) indicates the change of the severity of the condition from baseline, graded from "very much improved" to "very much worse".
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS). Full analysis set was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used. Three subjects were not included in the analysis due to incomplete case report forms.

outcome.title: Patient Global Improvement of Change (PGIC) at Final Visit (Week 8 or Discontinuation)
outcome.description: Patient Global Improvement of Change (PGIC) indicates the change of severity of conditions from baseline, graded from "very much improved" to "very much worse".
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS). Full analysis set was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used.

measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS). Full analysis set was derived from the set of all enrolled subjects who were administered the study medication and had post baseline documentation of efficacy. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) method was used.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of <60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), <12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
